svn path=/Zope/trunk/; revision=67995

Updated CHANGES.txt to reflect more closely work done on Zope-2_8-branch.

In the interest of keeping myself sane, I've left the "Trunk only
(unreleased)" section alone

carried forward from Zope-2_8-branch

svn path=/Zope/trunk/; revision=38072

Change message

svn path=/Zope/branches/Zope-2_8-branch/; revision=38063

Brought forward from the Zope 2.7 branch:

If the new value is _marker (basically, if we index with a value of
None), we should also remove the object from our _unindex

svn path=/Zope/branches/Zope-2_8-branch/; revision=38062

Brought forward from the Zope 2.7 branch:

  - deleted trailing whitespace

  - new test for removal (indexing an object with a value of None
    should remove it from the index)

svn path=/Zope/branches/Zope-2_8-branch/; revision=38061

Added note about changed ObjectManager._setObject behavior

svn path=/Zope/trunk/; revision=24460

- remove unnecessary additional complexity from the FauxUser (we
    don't test any of that here.)

  - include a test suite declaration

  - slight clarification on some of the test names and content ids

svn path=/Zope/trunk/; revision=24455

The key for 'Owner' local role should be the user's Id, not UserName

Special Users and security managers that return None objects should not play.

svn path=/Zope/trunk/; revision=24453

Test module for ObjectManager, testing only the changes to the
_setObject method.

Specifically the key for 'Owner' local role should be the user's Id,
not UserName

Tests this behavior with six combinations:

  'None' security manager attempting to set ownership
  'Emergency User' security manager attempting to set ownership
  'System User' security manager attempting to set ownership
  'Anonymous User' security manager attempting to set ownership
  'User' security manager attempting to set ownership
  'Faux User' security manager attempting to set ownership

  'None' security manager not attempting to set ownership
  'Emergency User' security manager not attempting to set ownership
  'System User' security manager not attempting to set ownership
  'Anonymous User' security manager not attempting to set ownership
  'User' security manager not attempting to set ownership
  'Faux User' security manager not attempting to set ownership

svn path=/Zope/trunk/; revision=24452

Fixed a tyop when reverting previously checked in changes

svn path=/Zope/trunk/; revision=24451

Reverted pending tests and further work.

svn path=/Zope/trunk/; revision=24450

Local Roles should be keyed to the user's Id, not Username, especially
when external user folders can specify a difference.

svn path=/Zope/trunk/; revision=24449

provide for alternative group implementations:

  <user>.getGroupsInContext( ob ) returns a list of group ids
    predicated on some attribute of ob (similar in nature to
    <user>.getRolesInContext( ob )

  <user>.getGroups() returns a list of groups of which the user is a
    member (similar in nature to global roles: <user>.getRoles())

Attempt to resolve group handling of the local __allow_groups__
object; if it doesn't play, ignore and move on.

in the utility functions, there is no longer any id mangling, as such,
what goes in is what comes out.
Reverted pending tests and further work.

provide for the current behavior when used with base_cms, and prepare
for use with PluggableAuthService, defaulting, in the absence of
either to an empty tuple.
We need to have a sane default, otherwise we get a cranky UnboundLocalError
Added a few notes in preparation for 1.0.3 release
Merging pre-1_0_3-zbir-challenge-branch to the head.

Refine the interface for IChallengePlugin to not raise exceptions
(since we're dealing with the _results_ of something else already
having raised an exception)

our marker object '_noroles' can't be tested for equality across the
Python-C bridge, so we have to exclude it here so that each
implementation (Python or C) can use its appropriate default.
removed some trailing whitespace
Somehow checked in a 1. Boo, Zac.

- Better ordering of the swapping of old and new acl_users. No
    rename shuffle, just capture all the user info and use it after
    deleting the old user folder

  - Do all the machinery in _migrate_user with the values from the
    preserved dictionary

- _extractUserIds *must* mangle the id that is returned via
    authentication with the id of the authenticating plugin, since a
    single credentials extractor can attempt authentication against
    any number of authenticating mechanisms.

  - Implement the registration for what will be our hook-point for the
    IChallengePlugin plugins.

- Since we're creating the Dummy Plugins to hold one value, it is
    easier to test if we also make the PLUGINID the id the plugin
    holds.

  - enumerate[Users|Groups] returns a tuple, not a list

  - test the new __before_traverse__ registration (and beef up the
    FauxObject to accommodate)

Contract for IAuthenticationPlugin is to return a bare None if we
can't authenticate, not (None, None)

Test the new searchPrincipals behavior to handle plugins that can
support *both* IUserEnumerationPlugin and IGroupEnumerationPlugin

Test authentication with old-style passwords (just
sha.sha().hexdigest()) so that they can peacefully co-exist with
new-style passwords (using AccessControl.AuthEncoding)

- Moved some of the dummy classes to the helpers module

  - Test the new behavior that will allow for principals no longer in
    the system to be displayed as "<foo: not found>" rather than raise
    exceptions.
Moved some of the dummy classes to the helpers module
Bring in the conformance tests

Use AccessControl.AuthEncoding for all passwords going forward (but
provide backwards compatibility for pre-existing ZODBUserManagers)

- Don't include 'Anonymous' and 'Authenticated' roles when adding a
    ZODBRoleManager.

  - Provide for *some* handle on principals that were assigned, but
    are no longer found by PAS

Provide for *some* handle on principals that were assigned, but are no
longer found by PAS
Cleanup excessive whitespace

- fix the missing arrows bug

  - fix the broken assumption in searchPrincipals (that a plugin can
    do user enumeration or group enumeration, but not both)

  - PAS adds the 'Authenticated' Role, not any IRolesPlugin plugin.

Some new files/modules:

  - CHANGES.txt - changelog

  - Extensions/upgrade.py - an example External Method for replacing
    the root acl_users folder with a PluggableAuthService instance.

  - plugins/tests/helpers.py - some commonly used dummy classes
Fix typo (IPropertiedUser used to be called IExtensibleUser)

plugins/RecursiveGroupsPlugin.py

    - The SimpleGroup class now more closely mimics a real principal.

PluggableAuthService.py

    - Use the emergency user's user name (the special users in
      AccessControl.User don't have user ids).

tests/test_PluggableAuthService.py

    - Test that PAS._findUser() will return the emergency user when presented
      with the emergency user's username.
Added ZPL to all modules
Unintentional checkin on initial import
Initial revision

our marker object '_noroles' can't be tested for equality across the
Python-C bridge, so we have to exclude it here so that each
implementation (Python or C) can use its appropriate default.

commit_list.message: Initial commit

New shapes

Line and Arc, and change the implementation of Quarter- and HalfCircle
to use the CircularSegment as superclass

Also drop draw_quarter_circle and draw_half_circle methods.

provide comparator methods to Point

And add center params for drawing arcs and circle segments

add caps, joins, and miter limits
use ctypes for the image byte array
add Rectangle

pep8ing
convenience merhod for banding

draw circles from their center

Also, return the calculated filename
proper argtypes
removed errant pdb
Line operations! and fix the band() function
convenience method
I don't even

Changes to determine Line's hash, and provide for snapshot images for CoreGraphicsCanvas

improvements

Affordance for fuzziness in banding
Property for diagonal length in canvases
Midtone convenience method for Colors
Provides for contains and intersects for Lines (technically, Segments).
